selected_quotes: Why male animals grow some ornaments--like horns and antlers--to extreme proportions #evolution
How some sexually selected traits, like beetles' horns, got so huge #video
Today's #EBJClub paper on insulin/IGF sensitivity as mechanism of sexually selected trait exaggeration is worth a read
Big horn: insulin signaling may impact the size of sexually selected ornaments, a proxy for mate fitness.

citation.abstract: Many male animals wield ornaments or weapons of exaggerated proportions. We propose that increased cellular sensitivity to signaling through the insulin/insulin-like growth factor (IGF) pathway may be responsible for the extreme growth of these structures. We document how rhinoceros beetle horns, a sexually selected weapon, are more sensitive to nutrition and more responsive to perturbation of the insulin/IGF pathway than other body structures. We then illustrate how enhanced sensitivity to insulin/IGF signaling in a growing ornament or weapon would cause heightened condition sensitivity and increased variability in expression among individuals--critical properties of reliable signals of male quality. The possibility that reliable signaling arises as a by-product of the growth mechanism may explain why trait exaggeration has evolved so many different times in the context of sexual selection.
citation.publisher: American Association for the Advancement of Science
citation.title: A Mechanism of Extreme Growth and Reliable Signaling in Sexually Selected Ornaments and Weapons

facebook.title: A Mechanism of Extreme Growth and Reliable Signaling in Sexually Selected Ornaments and Weapons
facebook.summary:
很多雄性競爭強烈的物種的雄性動物會長出誇張的特徵來吸引異性，或是促進自己打鬥勝利的機會。但是這類特徵如獨角仙的角，鍬形蟲的大顎或是雄鹿的犄角等，身體狀況較差的雄性幾乎永遠沒有辦法長出象徵身體狀況好的雄性動物的特徵。這到底是為什麼呢？

之前學者多半假設這類型的特徵需要花費太多能量維持，所以小型或劣質雄性沒辦法負荷。但是以獨角仙為例，長大根角根本不需要或太多多於能量，也不會造成大型雄蟲的生活不便（如飛行能力*這方面文獻請另外參考Doug Lab學生去年發表的文章*），那為什麼小型雄蟲還是沒出現騙子呢？

此研

news.title: Nashornkäfer: Mit großen Hörnern in die Paarungschlacht
news.summary: Und es kommt doch auf die Größe an: Männliche Nashornkäfer nutzen ihre Hörner im Paarungskampf. Doch auch für die Weibchen spielt die markante Waffe eine wichtige Rolle, zeigt eine Studie - sie liefert ihnen Informationen über mögliche Partner.

news.title: Big horned beetles are healthiest
news.summary: The size of a male rhinoceros beetle's horn is a genuine indicator of its health, according to researchers.
